People & Contacts.Notes: Local columnist with significant influence. Used the Swanage Town Council platform to post a politically biased comment during the pre-election 'Purdah' period, denouncing Phillippe Edes and endorsing Gary Suttle. This is a critical transgression.

The campaign's chosen candidate for the Town Council election. Referred to as 'The Mayor of Paul' and the opposition's 'nightmare'. The central figure for the election push. His nomination is considered an 'unthinkable victory'.

Dorset Coast Forum Coordinator (Head). Sent a critical email confirming the CAPTCHA was added to the survey mid-process on the 'recommendation' of Engagement HQ. This email is a key piece of evidence.
Conservative County Councillor running for the Swanage Town Council seat. Was endorsed by David Hollister in the Purdah violation.
Local property owner on The Mowlem Road. Independently contacted Dorset Coast Forum about the survey's CAPTCHA issue and was the recipient of the key email from Tony Powell.
Local resident on the corner. Initially described as 'hard work' and 'wishy-washy' regarding the vote but is a contact on the ground.
A key target for the email pressure campaign, with the goal of having his vote taken away.
A contact on the ground, described as a 'funny dude' who initially exhibited selfish interest but is part of the local network.
Contacts at the UK Statistics Authority. The target recipients for the formal document questioning the statistical validity of the council's survey process.
Alias for the 'Strategist' persona. Responsible for generating the campaign narrative and strategy.
Alias for the 'Technician' persona. Responsible for the technical infrastructure and data analysis.
The primary operational email persona used for initial outreach. All aliases feed into the same central account.

Organizations & Bodies.Notes: The tech company behind the survey software. Their relationship with 'Engagement HQ' and their role in the CAPTCHA addition is a key point of investigation.
A higher authority to which a formal complaint will be submitted regarding the flawed survey methodology used by the council.
Accused of showing bias in their presentation of the three road options, specifically by casting negative doubt only on the campaign's preferred 'Option 3'.
The entity that 'recommended' the addition of the CAPTCHA. Their exact identity and relationship to Granicus needs clarification.

Key Places & Events.Description: The central point of contention in the campaign. The proposed closure is the primary issue being fought.
The primary 'Impact Zone' for the proposed road closure and new car park development.
A specific road where one of the campaign's ground contacts resides.
Location of a school where children are 'dodging brick lorries'. Used as an example of the council's misplaced priorities (funding a Shore Road project over safety here).
A public consultation event where the council failed to provide paper surveys, cited as a failure to properly consult with residents.
Related Transgressions: Failure to provide paper surveys at consultation

Identified Transgressions.Transgression Summary: CAPTCHA added to official survey mid-process
Political endorsement during Purdah on official platform

Documents & Evidence.Notes: Email from Tony Powell to Sarah Streams confirming the CAPTCHA was added to the survey on the 'recommendation' of Engagement HQ. This is a critical piece of evidence proving process manipulation.
An independent analysis of the official survey which concluded, without prompting, that the survey was biased and structured unfairly. Validates the campaign's core arguments.
